Description: Rim sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; part of lotus flower in added white and red; top of rim glazed; exterior: band of dots between pairs of dilute lines at rim; below, painted decoration consisting of possibly male figure's head with trace of red stephane remaining, to left.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the rim pattern, see Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.79.1894.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0800) (phase 2)
